source.name: Demo Question
source.instructions:
## Reading Question
Rearrange the code blocks below to create a loop that iterates over a list and prints each element of the list. Indent blocks as you would in any C program. **Note**, some of the code blocks will not be used.

source.name: Practice MCQ
source.instructions:
## Multiple Choice Question
When was C originally developed?
source.guidance: C was originally developed at Bell labs, in 1972, by Dennis Ritchie.

source.name: Fill in the Blank Demo Question
source.instructions:
## Fill in the Blank
Fill in the blanks below.
source.text:
True or False: C is a compiled language. <<<True>>>
True or False: You do not use semi-colons at the end of each line of code in C. <<<False>>>
source.guidance:
C is a compiled language.
You must have a semi-colon at the end of each C statement.

text: True or False: C is a compiled language.
True or False: You do not use semi-colons at the end of each line of code in C.

source.name: Parsons Problem
source.instructions:
## Parson's Problem
Rearrange the code blocks below into the proper order. **Note**, not all of the code blocks will be used.
source.initial:
The first code block
The second code block
The third code block
I am not correct #distractor
I am not correct #distractor
source.guidance:
The first code block
The second code block
The third code block

source.name: standard code test demo
source.guidance:
Here is one possible solution to the problem:

```python
num = input()
try:
  num = int(num)
  print(num * 3)
except ValueError:
  print("Please enter an integer")
```

Remember, do not have a string with the `input` command. This solution uses the `try/except` block to see if the user input can be typecast into an int. If yes, the program prints the user input multiplied by 3. If the typecast cannot be done, then the message `Please enter an integer` is printed.

source.name: standard code test example c
